{{cpp/title | rbegin&lt;small&gt;(std::initializer_list)&lt;/small&gt;}}
{{cpp/utility/initializer_list/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|iterator}}
{{dcl | since=c++14|
template &lt;class E&gt;
std::reverse_iterator&lt;const E*&gt; rbegin( std::initializer_list&lt;E&gt; il );
}}
{{dcl end}}

The overload of {{lc|std::rbegin}} for {{tt|initializer_list}} returns an {{c|std::reverse_iterator}} pointing at the last element of {{tt|il}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par | il | an {{tt|initializer_list}} }}
{{par end}} 

===Return value===
{{c|std::reverse_iterator&lt;const E*&gt;(il.end())}}.

{{cpp/impldef exception}}

===Notes===
This overload is necessary because {{lc|std::initializer_list}} does not have a member function {{tt|rbegin}}. No overload is needed for {{lc|std::crbegin}} because it is implemented in terms of {{lc|std::rbegin}}.

===Example===
{{example
 |
 | code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;iterator&gt;
 
int main() 
{
    auto il = { 3, 1, 4 };
    for (auto it = std::rbegin(il); it != std::rend(il); ++it)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; *it &lt;&lt; ' '; 
}
 | output=
4 1 3
}}
